{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3016214,"name":"Dillon Cordes","username":"Dcordes","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/ee59a6/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-03-03T15:56:59.541Z","cooked":"

Hello everyone, as you all know we have a height restriction that limits our robots so they cannot extend past their bumpers by 16 inches as well as vertical restrictionâ€™s. How is everyone combatting this issue, and does anyone known a good resource for coding a motor height limit in the software side of things? thanks

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2022-03-03T15:56:59.541Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":18,"reads":225,"readers_count":224,"score":140.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":404538,"topic_slug":"any-ideas-with-height-restriction","display_username":"Dillon Cordes","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48833,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/any-ideas-with-height-restriction/404538/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3016217,"name":"Ryan Blue","username":"Ryan_Blue","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_blue/{size}/174016_2.png","created_at":"2022-03-03T15:59:08.079Z","cooked":"

The easiest way to prevent your robot from overextending is to implement hard stops that physically prevent it from doing so. This will also make inspection go much easier.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2022-03-03T15:59:08.079Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":222,"readers_count":221,"score":84.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":404538,"topic_slug":"any-ideas-with-height-restriction","display_username":"Ryan Blue","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29846,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/any-ideas-with-height-restriction/404538/2","custom_user_title":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3016220,"name":"Nick Lipcsik","username":"Nick_Lipcsik","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nick_lipcsik/{size}/161044_2.png","created_at":"2022-03-03T16:05:00.866Z","cooked":"
Dcordes:

so they cannot extend past their bumpers by 16 inches

Just to clarify, you canâ€™t extend more than 16 inches past your frame perimeter, not the end of your bumpers.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2022-03-03T16:05:00.866Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":208,"readers_count":207,"score":81.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":404538,"topic_slug":"any-ideas-with-height-restriction","display_username":"Nick Lipcsik","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":9}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32392,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/any-ideas-with-height-restriction/404538/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":7},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3016231,"name":"Gus Michel II","username":"GeeTwo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geetwo/{size}/120962_2.png","created_at":"2022-03-03T16:30:50.987Z","cooked":"
  • Fair solution: implement a combination of limit switches to motor controllers and limit switches and/or encoders to software to keep from exceeding the limits. Setting motor controllers to brake mode will help, too.
  • Better solution: As @Ryan_Blue said - make it physically impossible to exceed the maximum height and frame perimeter without breaking something.
  • Best solution: Both! The limit switches and encoders and software will keep you from hitting the hard stops at speed, so you donâ€™t break something.

In every case, test your system and make measurements BEFORE your robot inspector does!

Yeah, thatâ€™s what I pretty much found when it comes to software side of things. Iâ€™m still relatively new with programming so Iâ€™m not certain how to program the encoders to tell the motors to stop at a certain distance. However, it seems that a physical stop will be the better option in this instance.

For my teamâ€™s robot, we are using pancake cylinders as a physical block to prevent the arm from extending when on the field outside the climbing area (even accidentally).
And yes, absolutely ensure you have hard stops preventing an arm from extending beyond the 16 inch frame perimeter allowance

Depending on your motor, you can use CAN position control (and tune the PIDF values) to set a max position, but keep in mind the arm can still exceed that position when stabilizing into that final value, so you definitely want to utilize soft stops (like limit switches) to avoid extending too far
